tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 神八井耳命（かむやいみみのみこと、？ - 綏靖天皇4年（紀元前578年）4月）は、『古事記』『日本書紀』等に記される日本の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Kamuyaimimi no mikoto (year of birth unknown; died between May- June, 578B.C. (April, 578B.C. in old lunar calendar)) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan), etc.

Kamuyaimimi no mikoto (year of birth unknown; died in May, 578B.C.) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan), etc.
sen.cmt: 日付表記修正、全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: Kamuyaimimi no mikoto (year of birth unknown; died in May, 578B.C.) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan), etc.

sen.j: 神武天皇の皇子で、母は媛蹈鞴五十鈴媛命。
sen.e: He was a prince of the Emperor Jinmu, and his mother was Himetataraisuzuhime no mikoto.
He was a prince of the Emperor Jinmu, and his mother was Himetataraisuzuhime no mikoto.
He was a prince of the Emperor Jinmu, and his mother was Himetataraisuzuhime no mikoto.

sen.j: 同母兄弟に日子八井命（『新撰姓氏録』には子）・綏靖天皇がいる。
sen.e: His maternal half-brothers were Hikoyai no mikoto (he is described as a son in the "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility)) and the Emperor Suizei.
His maternal half-brothers were Hikoyai no mikoto (he is described as a son in the "Shinsen Shojiroku" [Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility]) and the Emperor Suizei.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーション→半角に修正、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: His maternal half-brothers were Hikoyai no mikoto (he is described as a son in the "Shinsen Shojiroku" [Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility]) and the Emperor Suizei.

sen.j: 父の神武天皇が崩じた後、朝政の経験に長けていた庶兄の手研耳命（たぎしみみのみこと）は皇位に就こうとした。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Jinmu (his father), Tagishi-miminomikoto (his older brother by a concubine), who had been in the political world for a long time, schemed to ascend the throne.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；原文に「タギシミミの反逆」とあるのはリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると「手研耳命」（たぎしみみのみこと）となっているので、これで訳出しました。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Jinmu (his father), Tagishimimi no mikoto (his older brother by a concubine), who had been in the political world for a long time, schemed to ascend the throne.
sen.cmt: Tagishi-miminomikoto→Tagishimimi no mikotoとしました。翻訳者コメントに基づき原文表記修正 (「タギシミミの反逆」→「手研耳命」)
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Jinmu (his father), Tagishimimi no mikoto (his older brother by a concubine), who had been in the political world for a long time, schemed to ascend the throne.

sen.j: そのために、弟たちを害そうとした。
sen.e: To fulfill this trick, Tagishi-miminomikoto plotted to kill his younger brothers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: To fulfill this trick, Tagishimimi no mikoto plotted to kill his younger brothers.
To fulfill this trick, Tagishimimi no mikoto plotted to kill his younger brothers.

sen.j: この陰謀を神渟名川耳尊（後の綏靖）・神八井耳命は母后の歌から察知した。
sen.e: Kamununakawa-miminomikoto (later the Emperor Suizei) and Kamiyaimimi no mikoto scented out this plot from their mother's poem.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kamununakawamimi no mikoto (later the Emperor Suizei) and Kamiyaimimi no mikoto scented out this plot from their mother's poem.
sen.cmt: Kamununakawa-miminomikoto→Kamununakawamimi no mikotoとし、全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正
sen.e: Kamununakawamimi no mikoto (later the Emperor Suizei) and Kamiyaimimi no mikoto scented out this plot from their mother's poem.

sen.j: 彼らは片丘（奈良県北葛城郡王寺町）の大窖にいる手研耳を襲い、これを討った。
sen.e: They attacked Tagishi-miminomikoto who was in a large mattamore in Kataoka (Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture), and successfully killed him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；「大窖」は正しい読み方不明ながら、①地名ではないようだ②「窖」という字は穴蔵、土蔵、地下貯蔵室を意味する③他の文献では「おおむろ」（「むろ」はあなかんむりの下に音）とするものがあり、室は倉庫のこと などから、大きな地下倉庫と解釈し、訳出しています。
sen.e: They attacked Tagishimimi no mikoto who was in a large mattamore in Kataoka (Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi County, Nara Prefecture), and successfully killed him.
sen.cmt: Tagishi-miminomikoto→Tagishimimi no mikoto、Kitakatsuragi-gun→Kitakatsuragi Countyとしました。
sen.e: They attacked Tagishimimi no mikoto who was in a large mattamore in Kataoka (Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi County, Nara Prefecture), and successfully killed him.

sen.j: この際、神八井耳は恐怖で手足が震えおののいて矢を放てなかった。
sen.e: On this occasion, Kamuyaimimi was shaking with fear, and was unable to shoot an arrow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On this occasion, Kamuyaimimi was shaking with fear, and was unable to shoot an arrow.
On this occasion, Kamuyaimimi was shaking with fear, and was unable to shoot an arrow.

sen.j: 代わりに神渟名川耳が射て殺したという。
sen.e: Instead, Kamununakawa-mimi no mikoto shot an arrow toward Tagishi-miminomikoto and killed him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Instead, Kamununakawamimi no mikoto shot an arrow toward Tagishimimi no mikoto and killed him.
sen.cmt: Kamununakawamimi no mikoto、Tagishimimi no mikotoとしました。
sen.e: Instead, Kamununakawamimi no mikoto shot an arrow toward Tagishimimi no mikoto and killed him.

sen.j: 神八井耳はこの失態を深く恥じ、弟が天皇として即位するに及び、これを助けて天神地祇を掌ることとなった。
sen.e: Kamuyaimimi was so deeply ashamed of this blunder that at the enthronement of his younger brother, he decided to help the new emperor by administering religious matters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kamuyaimimi was so deeply ashamed of this blunder that at the enthronement of his younger brother, he decided to help the new Emperor by administering religious matters.
Kamuyaimimi was so deeply ashamed of this blunder that at the enthronement of his younger brother, he decided to help the new Emperor by administering religious matters.
He passed away three years after that.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He passed away three years after that.
He passed away three years after that.

sen.j: 畝傍山の北墓に葬られたと伝えられる。
sen.e: Records say that he was buried in a tomb located at the northern slope of Mt. Unebi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Records say that he was buried in a tomb located at the northern slope of Mt. Unebi.
Records say that he was buried in a tomb located at the northern slope of Mt. Unebi.

sen.j: 現在、奈良県橿原市山本町の八幡神社（古く八井神社と呼ばれた）はその伝説地とされる。
sen.e: Yahata-jinja Shrine (which has long been called Yai-jinja Shrine) in Yamamoto-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture is considered to be a place related to this legend.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yahata-jinja Shrine (which has long been called Yai-jinja Shrine) in Yamamoto-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture is considered to be a place related to this legend.
Yahata-jinja Shrine (which has long been called Yai-jinja Shrine) in Yamamoto-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture is considered to be a place related to this legend.

sen.j: 『古事記』・『新撰姓氏録』・『先代旧事本紀』・『阿蘇氏系図』によれば、神八井耳命の子孫は繁多に分かれ、多氏（太安万侶の一族）・小子部氏・坂合部氏・火君・大分氏・雀部氏・小長谷氏・伊予国造・金刺氏・石城国造・丹羽氏・茨田連等がいた。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," "Shinsen Shojiroku," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), and "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), descendants of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto are ramified widely, and formed O clan (Family of O no Yasumaro), Chisakobe clan, Sakaibe clan, Hi no kimi, Oita clan, Sasabe clan, Konagaya clan, Iyonokuni no miyatsuko, Kanasashi clan, Iwakinokuni no miyatsuko, Niwa clan, Mamuta no muraji, and others.

According to the "Kojiki," "Shinsen Shojiroku," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), and "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), descendants of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto are ramified widely, and formed the O clan (Family of O no Yasumaro), Chisakobe clan, Sakaibe clan, Hi no kimi, Oita clan, Sasabe clan, Konagaya clan, Iyonokuni no miyatsuko, Kanasashi clan, Iwakinokuni no miyatsuko, Niwa clan, Mamuta no muraji, and others.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーション→半角に修正、the追加
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," "Shinsen Shojiroku," "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History), and "Aso-shi Keizu" (The Family Tree of Aso clan), descendants of Kamuyaimimi no mikoto are ramified widely, and formed the O clan (Family of O no Yasumaro), Chisakobe clan, Sakaibe clan, Hi no kimi, Oita clan, Sasabe clan, Konagaya clan, Iyonokuni no miyatsuko, Kanasashi clan, Iwakinokuni no miyatsuko, Niwa clan, Mamuta no muraji, and others.

sen.j: 現在、多氏の氏神社である多坐弥志理都比古神社（奈良県磯城郡田原本町）に祀られる。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Onimasumishiritsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture), a shrine commonly professed by O clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Onimasumishiritsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki County, Nara Prefecture), a shrine commonly professed by the O clan.
sen.cmt: Shiki County、the O clanとしました。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Onimasumishiritsuhiko-jinja Shrine (Tawaramoto-cho, Shiki County, Nara Prefecture), a shrine commonly professed by the O clan.

sen.j: その他、伊達神社 (和歌山市)（和歌山県和歌山市）・嶋田神社（奈良県奈良市）等の式内社にも祀られる。
sen.e: Adding to that, he is also enshrined at Idate-jinja Shrine (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture), Shimada-jinja Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and other Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Adding to that, he is also enshrined at Idate-jinja Shrine (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture), Shimada-jinja Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and other Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws).

Adding to that, he is also enshrined at Idate-jinja Shrine (Wakayama City, Wakayama Prefecture), Shimada-jinja Shrine (Nara City, Nara Prefecture) and other Shikinai-sha (shrines listed in Engishiki laws).

sen.j: なお、「神」が「醸む（かむ）」に通じることから、酒好きな神として祀る神社もある。
sen.e: As a part of his name, "kamu", can be connected to the word "kamu" which means "to brew sake", some shrines enshrine him as a deity who likes drinking.
As a part of his name, 'kamu,' can be connected to the word 'kamu' which means 'to brew sake,' some shrines enshrine him as a deity who likes drinking.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション表記修正、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: As a part of his name, 'kamu,' can be connected to the word 'kamu' which means 'to brew sake,' some shrines enshrine him as a deity who likes drinking.
